__comment: link is the weblink for HELP button. Window is for the brief description for each dialog.

Stats Summary.window: Generate statistical summaries such as Mean and Median for a single dataset, i.e. one column of data. The statistical measures are set by default, while percentile positions can be customized.

Stats Summary Multi Datasets.window: Generate statistical summaries, including measures such as Mean and Median, for multiple datasets (several columns of data). Users can select which statistical measures to include in the final output table.

Normality Test.window: Perform normality test to one column of data. Shapiro-Wilk and Anderson-Darling tests will be performed.

Confidence Intervals.window: Calculate and display the confidence intervals for the population mean and standard deviation using the sampling dataset, assuming the underlying population follows a normal distribution.

Fit Distributions.window: A fitted distribution is a theoretical distribution calculated using parameter estimates derived from a sample that you enter. This dialog can help to find the most suitable distribution to the sample. If plotting required, please use Plots>Histogram & Dist. Fit, however which can't compare across distributions.
